@type.description: The catagory of this JSON object, must be 'SoftwareSourceCode'

agents.description: A person or organization that has a role in designing, authoring, funding, maintaining or licensing the software.

@id.description: A universally unique character string that is associated with the software agent.

@type.description: The catagory of agent, for example 'person' or 'organization'

email.description: The email address associated with the agent of the software.

name.description: The name of the institution, organization, individuals or other entities that had a role in the creation of the software.

affiliation.description: The institution, organization or other group that the agent is associated with.

mustBeCited.description: A logical value (true/false) indicating that an agent must be included in a citation of the software.

isMaintainer.description: A logical value (true/false) indicating whether an agent (SoftwareAuthor, SoftwareContributor, etc.) is the active maintainer of the software.

isRightsHolder.description: logical value (true/false) indicating whether an agent is the current agent that is the rights holder of the software, for example, does the user own the account related to the software in a source code repository, etc.

role.description: The function assumed or part played by a person or organization in relation to creation of the software.

namespace.description: The URL where the namespace for the roleCodes is located.

roleCode.description: A text string indicating the catagory of the role, for example 'author', 'contributor', 'funder', etc.

depends.description: The computer hardware and software required to run the software.

identifier.description: A text string uniquely identifying the required software package.

name.description: The text string identifying a software package within a packageSystem.

version.description: A text string indicating the development stage of the software package

packageSystem.description: The repository system that contains a software package.

operatingSystem.description: The computer system types that the software successfully operates on, i.e. 'Mac OS X 10.5', 'Windows 7'.

identifier.description: A universally unique character string associated with the software.

name.description: A universally unique character string associated with the software.

codeRepository.description: A URL for the source code repository that contains the software source files.

controlledTerms.description: Keywords associated with the software (i.e. fixed vocabulary by which to describe a category or community of softwarecontrolled terms

datePublished.description: he date the software was first made available  publicly by the publisher.

dateModified.description: The date that a published version of the software was updated by the software author.

dateCreated.description: The date that a published version of the software was created by the software author.

description.description: A character string conveying the purpose and scope of the software.

developmentStatus.description: A designation of the current state of the software in the development lifecycle, e.g. (“active”, “inactive”) or (“beta”, “candidate release”, “release”), etc.

embargoDate.description: A calendar date specifying the end of a restricted access period, i.e. the date that the software may be made publicly available.

isAutomatedBuild.description: A logical value (true/false) indicating whether an update to the *CodeRepository* will trigger a new executable version of the software to be generated.

publisher.description: The institution, organization or other entity that has made a distributable version of the software publicly available.

tags.description: Terms used to describe the software that facilitate discovery of the software.

licenseId.description: The name of the license agreement governing the use and redistribution of the software. e.g. 'Apache-2.0', 'GPL-3.0', 'LGPL-3.0'

title.description: he distinguishing name associated with the software.

version.description: A unique string indicating a specific state of the software, i.e. an initial public release, an update or bug fix release, etc. No version format or schema is enforced for this value.

uploadedBy.description: The user identity that uploaded the software to an online repository.

@id.description: A universally unique string identifying the agent that uploaded the software to a repository.

@type.description: The category of agent that performed the upload, for example 'person'

email.description: The email address associated with the agent that uploaded the software.

name.description: A name associated with the agent.

buildInstructions.description: A URL for the instructions to create an executable version of the software from source code.

contIntegration.description: A URL for the continuous integration system used to build the software automatically after updates to the source code repository.

downloadLink.description: The URL to obtain the distribution of the software from.

funding.description: An institution, organization or other entity that has provided monetary resources needed to develop, test, distribute or support the software.

programmingLanguage.description: The computer language that the software is implemented with.

name.description: A name associated with the programming language.

version.description: A text string describing the development stage of the software.

URL.description: A URL where the software can be obtained.

readme.description: A URL for the file that provides general information about the software.

issueTracker.description: A URL for the issue tracking system used to report problems and request features, etc., for the software.

relatedLink.description: A URL that provides additional information or resources related to the software.

relatedPublications.description: Publications that cite the software or describe some related aspect of it.

relationships.description: Relationship of the software to other related resources. For example, this relationship might be how one software package relates to a larger suite, or how a software package version supercedes a previous version.

relationshipType.description: The category of relationship, for example 'IspartOf', 'IsCitedBy', 'Cites', 'IsSupplementTo'

relatedIdentifier.description: A universally unique text string containing the identifier.

relatedIdentifierType.description: The category of the identifier, for example: 'DOI', 'LSID', 'UUID'

suggests.description: External software components that could enhance operation of or enable advanced functionality of the software package but are not strictly required.

identifier.description: A text string uniquely identifying the required software package.

name.description: The text string identifying a software package within a packageSystem.

version.description: A text string indicating the development stage of the software package

packageSystem.description: The repository system that contains a software package.

operatingSystem.description: The computer system types that the software successfully operates on, i.e. 'Mac OS X 10.5', 'Windows 7'.

softwarePaperCitationIdentifiers.description: A text string that can be used to authoritatively cite a research paper, conference proceedings or other scholarly work that describes the design, development, usage, significance or other aspect of the software.

zippedCode.description: A URL for the software distribution in compressed form.
